Lack of credible evidence: The expert states that they have not seen any credible evidence of hackers posting sexual videos and pictures on Facebook walls. This suggests that there is no concrete proof to support the claim.
Vague and unsourced warning: The expert points out that the warning being circulated on Facebook is vague and lacks specific details about how hackers are gaining access to accounts. The lack of specific information makes the claim less credible.
No solution provided: The warning does not offer any solution or preventive measures for users to protect themselves from this alleged activity. This lack of actionable advice undermines the authenticity of the claim.
Previous debunking efforts: The expert mentions that other fact-checking sites have previously investigated similar warnings dating back to 2011. The fact that these warnings have been debunked in the past raises doubts about the credibility of the current claim.
